members.member:
Maximum distance damage propagates to.
Propagated damage at distance x is computed as follows: dmg' = dmg * (1 - x / DamagePropagationDistance) ^ DamagePropagationExponent

member.name: P:Medieval.Definitions.Components.Grid.MyGridDestructionComponentDefinition.DamagePropagationDistanceInv
member.summary: Inverse of maximum distance damage propagates to. 1 / DamagePropagationDistance.

member.summary: Linear impulse applied to fracture pieces on generation will be multiplied by this value.

member.name: P:Medieval.Definitions.Components.Grid.MyGridDestructionComponentDefinition.AngularImpulseMulti
member.summary: Angular impulse applied to fracture pieces on generation will be multiplied by this value.

members.member:
Exponent that curves the damage modification over distance.
Propagated damage at distance x is computed as follows: dmg' = dmg * (1 - x / DamagePropagationDistance) ^ DamagePropagationExponent

Manually tries to schedule a new recipe for future crafting.
May fail if - Recipe is not allowed. - Queue is full. - Resources not available.

member.name: T:Medieval.Entities.Components.MyRespawnLocation
member.summary: Base class for an object representing a respawn location.
member.remarks:
Respawn locations are position in the world where a player can respawn. These objects are created by Respawn Providers (see ), which are either session or entity components.
These providers can optionally have their data cached by the . This is useful for providers on entities that can be unloaded by the component.

member.name: M:Medieval.Entities.Components.Planet.MyPlanetAreaOwnershipComponent.GetWaypointPosition(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Calculate the most Tim friendly position for the waypoint inside of the area.
This position is now the evrage center of all grids inside the area. It disconsiders any grids outside the area to avoid having the waypoint itself outside.
If all grids in the area have their centers outside we use the center of the area. Ideally we'd find which blocks are inside and use their positions instead but tha'ts a bit too much.

member.name: M:Medieval.GameSystems.Mining.MyOreDeposit.GetInitialMaterialCount
member.summary:
Get the total amount of ore contained in this deposit.This value is the total volume, how much ore in items depends on how the deposit is mined and the mining definitions.
This is the original; amount before mining.
member.remarks:
This call is not fast and calling it in main thread should be avoided.
This call will cache the results after the first time it's invoked.

member.name: M:Medieval.GameSystems.Mining.MyOreDeposit.GetCurrentMaterialCount
member.summary: Get the current amount of ore still contained in this deposit.This value is the total volume, how much ore in items depends on how the deposit is mined and the mining definitions.
member.remarks:
This call is not fast and calling it in main thread should be avoided.
This call will not cache the results, so invoking it after modifying the deposit will yield up to date results.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Inventory_ContextualHelp
member.summary: Inventory Controls Double-click: Move item stack to the next inventory. Shift-click: Move all items of selected type to the next inventory. Ctrl-click: Move half of the item stack to the next inventory. Alt-click: Move one item from stack to the next inventory. Right-click: Activate Item. Right-click drag: Move half of the item stack. Ctrl + right-click drag: Drag an item and enter the amount to move.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Crafting_ContextualHelp_Tooltip
member.summary: [KEY:HelpScreen] Show help.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Crafting_ContextualHelp
member.summary: Crafting Controls Double-click recipe: Add recipe to queue. Ctrl + double-click: Add recipe to queue 5 times. Shift + double-click: Add recipe to queue 10 times. Shift + Ctrl + double-click: Add recipe to queue 15 times. These modifiers also work for the craft button. Right-click production queue: Remove item from production queue.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Map_ContextualHelp_Tooltip
member.summary: [KEY:HelpScreen] Show help.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Map_ContextualHelp
member.summary: Click on the areas on the globe to the left to select the different kingdoms on the planet. Double-click on a region on the map to zoom into an area. Right-click on the map to zoom back out to region overview. Green shields indicate areas owned by you. Blue shields indicate areas owned by allies. The money bag icon indicates there are taxes about to run out. The red arrows indicate that there is conflict in this region or area. The House/tower/castle icon indicates there are constructions in this area. Click the fast travel button to enable fast travel mode.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ToolTip_Map_FastTravelButton
member.summary: Fast Travel is used to cover long distances. In advanced world options it can be disabled completely and travel limitations can be turned on and off. Travel limitations limit travel to only those areas with roads. Enemies can block roads from fast travel by claiming areas on the road. The traversable area can be extended by building claim blocks in adjacent areas.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_Usage
member.summary: How To Search

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_UsageDescription
member.summary: Enter search parameters into the box at the top of the screen to to find blocks and items in the game. Click the advanced search tab on the right for a list of search parameters.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_Limitations
member.summary: Search Limitations

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_LimitationsDescription
member.summary: Not all blocks and items are available in every game mode. In survival mode, many blocks and items are unknown to the character until they have been learned through research. Search limitations can be disabled in the settings tab to the right by unchecking "Only Show Available". Doing this is a good way to learn about blocks and items that are not yet known by the character.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_Toolbar
member.summary: Toolbar Interaction

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_ToolbarDescription
member.summary: Blocks and items can be dragged to the toolbar. This includes all large blocks and any small blocks or items that are in the character's inventory. See block and item tooltips for additional controls.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_Bookmarks
member.summary: Bookmarks

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Help_BookmarksDescription
member.summary: Search bookmarks are on the left side of the screen and they can be customized. Create a new bookmark by searching for what you want and then clicking the + below the last bookmark. Give it a name and click OK. Shift+Click on bookmarks to delete them. Restore the default bookmarks by clicking the ? button, clicking the settings tab on the right side of the screen, and clicking the "Restore Bookmarks" button.

member.summary: Only Show Available

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Settings_OnlyShowAvailable_Tooltip
member.summary: Only show items and blocks that have been unlocked through research.

member.summary: Show Advanced Tooltips

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Settings_AdvancedTooltips_Tooltip
member.summary: Displays the following additional information at the bottom of tooltips: - Definition ID's - Item tags - Mod information Notice: Not all of these are applicable to each result.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Advanced_PrefixColumnName
member.summary: Prefix

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.ScreenSearch_Advanced_DescriptionColumnName
member.summary: Description

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_SingleString
member.summary: Search by phrase

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_SingleString
member.summary: This search prefix matches names including whitespace. Example: '{0}Stone Cube' will find everything that has the phrase 'Stone Cube' in the name, including any spaces.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_SplitString
member.summary: This search prefix matches names.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_SplitString
member.summary: This search prefix matches names. Example: 'Stone Cube' and 'Cube Stone' will return the 'Stone Cube' block.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_Type
member.summary: Search by type

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_Type
member.summary: This search prefix matches item types. Example: '{0}Item' will find anything that has the word 'item' in its type, like EquipmentItem, HandItem, or ConsumableItem.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_Block
member.summary: Search by block size

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_Block
member.summary: This search prefix matches block sizes. Example: '{0}Large' will find all large grid blocks.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_Mod
member.summary: Search by mod name

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_Mod
member.summary: This search prefix matches mod names. Example: '{0}Hats' will find everything that came with the mod that has the word 'Hats' somewhere in its name.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_Tag
member.summary: Search by tag

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_Tag
member.summary: This search prefix matches tags. Example: '{0}Ingot' will find every item and block that is tagged as 'Ingot'.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_Category
member.summary: Search by category

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_Category
member.summary: This search prefix matches category names. Example: '{0}Wall' will find everything that is contained within any category that has the word 'Wall' in its name.

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.DisplayName_Search_Usage
member.summary: Search by usage

member.name: F:Medieval.MyMedievalTexts.Description_Search_Usage
member.summary: This search prefix matches names. It then lists every other item or block in the game, that can be crafted by using the block or item matching the string. Example: '{0}Log' will find every item or block that uses an item named 'Log' for building or crafting.
